Stop saying 'remember Iraq' to justify doing nothing while 12,000 die. Iraq was artificial, invaded, sabotaged by Iran itself. Iran is ancient, rising internally, with no saboteur. Not. The. Same.

turkmenchay_to_china_deal.title: From Turkmenchay to China: 200 Years of Iran's Great Power Trap
turkmenchay_to_china_deal.hook: In 1828, Iran signed away its Caucasus to Russia. In 2021, the mullahs signed another deal Iranians call 'new Turkmenchay.' A thread on Iran's great power problem - and solution. ðŸ§µ

structure.template: In 1828, Iran signed away the Caucasus to Russia. In 2021, mullahs signed a deal Iranians call 'new Turkmenchay.' A thread on Iran's great power trap - and how free Iran escapes it. ðŸ§µ
February 21, 1828: Treaty of Turkmenchay. After losing two wars to Russia, Iran ceded: Armenia, Azerbaijan, Dagestan. The Aras River became the border. It still is. Iran's greatest humiliation.
Turkmenchay split families, peoples, nations. Azerbaijanis divided. Armenians divided. 200 years later, that wound still bleeds. Every unequal deal since has been compared to it.
1813-1907: The Great Game. Britain vs Russia. Iran as buffer state. In 1907, they divided Iran into spheres WITHOUT CONSULTING IRAN. The north to Russia. The south to Britain. The insult endures.
But there was another era. The Silk Road. For 2,000 years, Iran and China traded as EQUALS. Parthian princes brought Buddhism to China. Sassanid coins found in Guangzhou. Partnership, not clienthood.
2021: The 25-year Iran-China deal. $400 billion investment. Iranian critics immediately called it 'new Turkmenchay.' Why? The mullahs were selling sovereignty to survive sanctions.
The Islamic Republic has no leverage. Isolated from the West, it begs China for scraps. Sells oil at discount. Provides drones to Russia. Junior partner in an axis of desperation.
Free Iran has LEVERAGE. World's 2nd largest gas reserves. Belt and Road geography (China needs Iran). Western investment waiting. 89 million educated consumers. Partners compete for access.
The Silk Road was two-way trade between equals. Turkmenchay was surrender. The China deal was desperation. Free Iran chooses: partner to all, client to none. That's what 2026 is about.

1978's revolution was a COALITION. Liberals wanting democracy. Leftists wanting socialism. Nationalists wanting independence. Islamists wanting theocracy. They agreed on one thing: Shah must go.
Khomeini promised everyone what they wanted. In Paris, he told Western journalists he'd be a 'Gandhi figure.' He promised not to rule directly. He promised women's rights would be protected.
1979-1981: Khomeini purged the liberals first. Mehdi Bazargan resigned. Sadegh Ghotbzadeh executed. Abolhassan Banisadr impeached, fled. Anyone who believed the 'Gandhi' talk: eliminated.
1981-1988: Then the leftists. MEK, Tudeh, Fadaiyan. Thousands imprisoned, thousands executed. The 1988 prison massacre: 5,000-30,000 political prisoners killed in weeks. Khomeini's last act.
March 8, 1979: 100,000 women marched against mandatory hijab. Khomeini had promised. He lied. Women who helped make the revolution were its first victims. They've never stopped fighting.
By 1988, Khomeini had murdered EVERYONE who helped him. Liberals. Leftists. Nationalists. Even Islamists who disagreed. The 'revolution' was complete. It was a counter-revolution all along.
But they couldn't kill the memory. Parents told children. Exiles wrote books. The truth survived. The grandchildren of 1978's revolutionaries know what was stolen from them.
2022: 'Woman, Life, Freedom.' 2026: Revolution 2.0. This time, no Khomeini in Paris with false promises. This time, they know who the enemy is. This time, they won't be fooled.
2026 isn't a new revolution. It's the SAME revolution - 47 years delayed. The revolution Khomeini stole. The freedom 1978 demanded. The Iran that should have been. Finally becoming.

structure.template: Every time Iran faces crisis, someone predicts 'fragmentation.' Kurds will break away. Azeris will join Azerbaijan. Baluch will revolt. They've been wrong for 2,500 years. Here's why. ðŸ§µ
Yes, Iran is diverse. Persian 61%, Azeri 16%, Kurdish 10%, Lur 6%, Arab 2%, Baluch 2%, Turkmen 2%. But diversity â‰  division. Switzerland has 4 languages. India has 22. Nations hold.
TEST #1: 1980. Saddam invades. Expects Arabs of Khuzestan (oil-rich, bordering Iraq) to defect. They fought FOR Iran. Eight years of war. Not one province defected. Not one.
TEST #2: 1946. Soviets occupy northern Iran. Create puppet 'Azerbaijan People's Republic.' Expect Azeris to rally to ethnic brothers. They didn't. When Iranian army returned, they cheered.
TEST #3: 2026. Protests in ALL 31 provinces. Kurdish KDPI calls for solidarity with ALL Iranians. Azeris march with Persians. Baluch protest in Zahedan. TOGETHER. Not separately.
Yugoslavia was created in 1918, collapsed in 1991. 73 years. Iran has existed for 2,500 years. Survived Greeks, Arabs, Mongols, Turks, Russians, British. It's not Yugoslavia. Stop comparing.

Iranian identity isn't ethnicity. It's civilization. Ferdowsi's Shahnameh. Hafez's poetry. Nowruz. 3,000 years of shared culture. You can be Kurdish AND Iranian. Azeri AND Iranian. They're not exclusive.
The regime WANTS you to fear fragmentation. That's how they stay in power. 'Us or chaos.' But Iranians aren't fighting each other. They're fighting the regime. TOGETHER. 2,500 years strong.
